Dual-POB Library

v1.O

Introduction:

The Dual-POB Library provides various functions to use the dual-pob hardware:
  • input/output functions (with analog to digital and digital I/O),
  • communications protocols (bluetooth, I2C bus, Pobeye camera communication and uart),
  • servomotor management (bioloid servomotors or Dual-Servo)
  • and various utils functions (timer functions, eeprom ...)

Using the library:

First, You have to install the WinAVR compiler and the AVR Studio.

This 2 tools are available on the provided cdrom, if you have any problem to get them, you can found this tools at http://winavr.sourceforge.net/ and at http://www.atmel.com/dyn/Products/tools_card.asp?tool_id=2725

In AVR Studio, you have to set the correct processor code (atmega128) and correct frequency (16000000).

Next the compiler must known the location of the Dual-POB library:

  • Add in the include section the Include repertory of Dual-POB (by default, the include repertory is at C:/Program Files/POB-Technology/DUAL-POB/lib/include)
  • In the library section of AVR, you must add the dualpoblib.a (by default, the library is at C:/Program Files/POB-Technology/DUAL-POB/lib/dualpoblib.a).

After that, you can copy/paste the next code to test your project settings:

 #include <Dual-POB.h>

int main(void)
{
        InitUART0(19200);

        SendString("Hello world from DUAL-POB!");

        while(1) ;      

        return 0;
}

Examples

You can find Dual-POB examples code on your computer at this location:

C:/Program Files/POB-Technology/DUAL-POB/examples
